learning_outcomes.description: Apply a range of skills and analyse a body of knowledge, and thus to demonstrate the potential to succeed at more advanced levels
Contribute to the chosen field of study through the development of new ideas or critical review of existing perspectives
Demonstrate an ability to find and assess information, and particularly to estimate the relevance of arguments and methods for tackling specific problems
Present scholarly arguments, logically and lucidly

assessments.task_description:
A complete draft of the thesis AND accompanying Turnitin report (PDF copy) must be presented for feedback from the Thesis Advisor(s). Please note that if you submit your draft after this date, you may not receive timely feedback.

If your thesis is not available in draft form by this date, you should submit whatever written work you have as well as a Turnitin report. This is very important as it will give both you and your Thesis Advisor time to review your progress, address any issues, and plan the completion of your thesis. Failure to submit written drafts by this date will almost certainly mean a poor result for your final product.

Please refer to the SOSC6014 Blackboard for detailed guidance on the suggested content and formatting of the thesis document.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submitted directly via email to the student's Thesis Advisor(s).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: This is a formative assessment only. Failure to submit your thesis full draft and Turnitin report to your Thesis Advisor by the due date will not result in any penalty, but it will impact on receiving timely feedback from your Advisor.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Task: Students are to produce a thesis document between 12,000 and 15,000 words in length, which is the product of their own independent research undertaken during the Honours period. The thesis is to be written, structured, and formatted under the guidance of the student's Thesis Advisor(s) and in accordance with the guidelines provided on Blackboard. In addition to the written thesis, students are required to participate in a pass/fail oral defence hurdle on the thesis (see 'Hurdle Requirements' below).

Word count exclusions: text in figures, diagrams, and tables; fore-pages (title page up to the first page of the first or introductory chapter), appendices, and reference list or bibliography.

Use of Artificial Intelligence Tools: This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst there may be instances where it is appropriate for students to use AI tools in their thesis project, successful completion of the thesis assessment will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. AI tools (including generative AI and machine translation tools) should be used with caution as they may lead to disputes about copyright, authorship, plagiarism, and research integrity. If you plan to use AI tools in the research or writing of your thesis, you MUST consult with your Thesis Advisor and/or Honours Convenor to discuss how you plan to use it, whether this usage is appropriate, how to document this usage, and how to acknowledge AI usage in your submitted assessment. A failure to reference AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. Guidelines on how to reference AI in your assessment can be found here: https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/referencing/ai-tools-assignments (additional guidance will be provided on Blackboard). UQ guidelines on AI usage can be found at the UQ AI Student Hub: https://web.library.uq.edu.au/study-and-learning-support/ai-student-hub including UQ rules for using AI.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your assignment electronically by the due time, on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
